archiefmat.scope:
1: 1780 Record Book [is missing];

2A: 1802[-1803] Ordinances for Berbice [period of restored Dutch rule];

2B: 1783 Ordinances, Proclamations and Government Notices [for Demarara. Period of French occupation];

3A: 1790-1792 Ditto [for Demarara and Essequibo. Mainly publications];

3B: 1796-1802 Ditto [is something totally different, mid-19th century];

4: 1781-1894 Subject Unknown [is totally different, non-Dutch 1840s];

5: 1814 Ditto [is different, non-Dutch mid-19th century];

6: 1765-1778 Ditto [is different, non-Dutch mid-19th century];

7: 1740 Ditto [is different, non-Dutch circa 1860];

8: 1734-1756 Publications [for Berbice, with an index];

9: 1788-1797 Ditto [for Berbice. These publications do not have the nature of law. They are notifications and advertisements to the society of the colony, announcing changes of a personal or business character];

10: 1797-1809 Ditto [for Berbice. These publications do not have the nature of law. They are notifications and advertisements to the society of the colony, announcing changes of a personal or business character. Fragile state];

11: 1825-1826 Letter Book [British period];

12: 1814-1817 Ditto [British period];

13: 1805-1810 [for Berbice, mostly written in Dutch, some in English. Very fragile state];

14: 1791-1798 Subject Unknown [in reality a Letter Book from Demarara];

15: 1765[-1804] Actions to Court of Civil Justice [for Berbice. In reality requests to the Court, in part from the Board of Orphans. Partly damaged and fragile];

16: 1873 Minutes of the Review Court Berbice (Civil & Criminal Justice) [British period];

17: 1872[=1812]-1873[=1813] Subject Unknown [for Berbice. In reality concerns demands for the Court of Civil Justice. All English language];

18: Date ? Ditto [Printed book=Groot Placaatboek ... Staaten Generaal, ... Staaten van Holland ... Staaten van Zeeland. Volume 8 (1795)];

19: 1803-1809 Current Cash A/C Book Essequibo & Demarara;

20: [1735-]1778[=1804] Subject Unknown [for Berbice. It concerns a list of manumitted slaves including letters of manumission. Very fragile and damaged. Needs urgent restoration];

21A:[1737-]1780 Instructions [for Berbice's officials and servants. Includes also some regulations of the nature of law. Documents usually do not have dates];

21B: 1895-1896 Subject Unknown [British period];

22A: 1793-1795 Subject Unknown [for Berbice, protocols. Actually follow-up to AC9 14];

22B: 1900-1901 Ditto [British period];

23: 1809[-1810] Ditto [for Berbice. Minutes of Council of Policy and Civil and Criminal Justice. In English and Dutch. Follow-up to AB3 101];

24: Date ? Ditto [Printed book=Groot Placaatboek ... Staaten Generaal, ... Staaten van Holland ... Staaten van Zeeland. Volume 9 (1796)];

25: 1660-1758 [Date unknown] Ditto [Printed book=Groot Placaatboek ... Staaten Generaal, ... Staaten van Holland ... Staaten van Zeeland. Probably volume 8 (1795)];

26: Date ? [Circa 1764-1772] Ditto [for Berbice. Protocols of public auctions of properties, mostly slaves];

27: 1763[=1765-]1766 Ditto [for Berbice. Protocols. Should be part of AC 9];

28: Date ? [1736-1802] Ditto [for Berbice. Deeds of giving out lands on the west sea coast stretching from Post Nieuw-Slot to Kreek Abary. Also includes protocols of measurement of lands all over the colony];

29: 1811 Minutes of the Secretary [for Demarara. In fact protocols, in part pre-printed. Should be added to AC 9];

30: Date ? [1789-1791] Subject unknown [for Berbice. Protocols of public auctions of properties, movable goods, no slaves];

31A: 1802-1803 [Minutes of the] Court of Civil Justice [for Berbice. Should be added to AB 3. Fragile state];

31B: 1803 Subject unknown [for Berbice. Protocols of a notary nature, should be part of AC 9. Fragile state];

32: 1773[=1766]-1775[=1785] Subject unknown [for Berbice. Protocols of public auctions of properties, mostly slaves. Also contains protocols of a notary nature, should be part of AC 9];

33: 1783-1784 Ditto [for Berbice. Protocols, should be part of AC 9];

34: Date ? [1794-1812] Ditto [For Berbice. Publications and Notifications. At first in Dutch, from about 1805 in English. From about 1804 are the original printed versions of the publications available];

35: 1775-1784 Ditto [for Berbice. Notifications and advertisements to the society of the colony, announcing changes of a personal or business character];

36: 1801-1806 Ditto [for Berbice, Indictement and Sentention Book of the Court of Criminal Justice. Fragile];

37: 1805-1813[=1812] Ditto [for Berbice. Publications and Notifications. At first in Dutch, sometimes in two languages, but from about 1810 totally in English. Very fragile];

38: 1788-1795 Ditto [for Berbice. Extracts of resolutions of the Directors of the Societeit van Berbice and of the States General. Includes also an index to the resolutions of Directors of the Societeit from 1720 to 1795];

39: 1802-1803 Extracts of Resolutions [for Berbice, from the Raad van Amerikaanse Kolonien en Bezittingen];

40: Mixed years Subject unknown [for Demarara and probably Berbice, miscellaneous papers. Very fragile];

41: 1756-1781 Ditto [for Demarara, including protocols of measurement, transfer of property, testaments, etcetera. Fragile].

2B: 1783 Ordinances, Proclamations and Government Notices [for Demarara. Period of French occupation];

3B: 1796-1802 Ditto [is something totally different, mid-19th century];

6  : 1765-1778 Ditto [is different, non-Dutch mid-19th century];

7  : 1740 Ditto [is different, non-Dutch c. 1860];

8  : 1734-1756 Publications [for Berbice, with an index];

9  : 1788-1797 Ditto [for Berbice. These publications do not have the nature of law. They are notifications and advertisements to the society of the colony, announcing changes of a personal or business character];

10 : 1797-1809 Ditto [for Berbice. These publications do not have the nature of law. They are notifications and advertisements to the society of the colony, announcing changes of a personal or business character];

11 : 1825-1826 Letter Book [British period];

12 : 1814-1817 Ditto [British period];

13 : 1805-1810 [for Berbice, mostly written in Dutch, some in English];

14 : 1791-1798 Subject unknown [in reality a letter book from Demarara];

15 : 1765[-1804] Actions to Court of Civil Justice [for Berbice. In reality requests to the Council, in part from the orphan masters];

16 : 1873 Minutes of the Review Court Berbice (Civil & Criminal Justice) [British period];

17 : 1872[=1812]-1873[=1813] Subject unknown [for Berbice. In reality concerns demands for the Council of Civil Justice. All English text];

18 : Date ? Ditto [Printed book=Groot Placaatboek ... Staaten Generaal, ... Staaten van Holland ... Staaten van Zeeland. Volume 8 (1795)];

19 : 1803-1809 Current Cash A/C Book Essequibo & Demarara;

20 : [1735-]1778[=1804] Subject unknown [for Berbice. It concerns a list of manumitted slaves including manumission letters];

21A:[1737-]1780 Instructions [for Berbice's officials and servants. Includes also some regulations of the nature of law. Documents usually do not have dates];

21B: 1895-1896 Subject unknown [British period];

22A: 1793-1795 Subject unknown [for Berbice, protocols. Actually follow-up to AC9 14];

22B: 1900-1901 Ditto [British period];

23 : 1809[-1810] Ditto [for Berbice. Minutes of the Council of Policy and Civil and Criminal Justice. In English and Dutch. Follow-up to AB3 101];

24 : Date ? Ditto [Printed book=Groot Placaatboek ... Staaten Generaal, ... Staaten van Holland ... Staaten van Zeeland. Volume 9 (1796)];

25 : 1660-1758 [Date unknown] Ditto [Printed book=Groot Placaatboek ... Staaten Generaal, ... Staaten van Holland ... Staaten van Zeeland. Probably volume 8 (1795)];

26 : Date ? [c. 1764-1772] Ditto [for Berbice. Protocols of public auctions of properties, mostly slaves];

27 : 1763[=1765-]1766 Ditto [for Berbice. Protocols. Should be part of AC 9];

28 : Date ? [1736-1802] Ditto [for Berbice. Deeds of land grant on the west sea coast stretching from Post Nieuw-Slot to Kreek Abary. Also includes protocols of measurement of lands all over the colony];

29 : 1811 Minutes of the Secretary [for Demarara. In fact protocols, in part pre-printed. Should be added to AC 9];

30 : Date ? [1789-1791] Subject unknown [for Berbice. Protocols of public auctions of properties, movable goods, no slaves];

31A: 1802-1803 [Minutes of the] Court of Civil Justice [for Berbice. Should be added to AB 3];

31B: 1803 Subject unknown [for Berbice. Protocols of a notary nature, should be part of AC 9];

32 : 1773[=1766]-1775[=1785] Subject unknown [for Berbice. Protocols of public auctions of properties, mostly slaves. Also contains protocols of a notary nature, should be part of AC 9];

33 : 1783-1784 Ditto [for Berbice. Protocols, should be part of AC 9];

34 : Date ? [1794-1812] Ditto [For Berbice. Publications and notifications. At first in Dutch, from about 1805 in English. From about 1804 the original printed versions of the publications are available];

35 : 1775-1784 Ditto [for Berbice. Notifications and advertisements to the society of the colony, announcing changes of a personal or business character];

36 : 1801-1806 Ditto [for Berbice, Indictement and Sentention Book of the Council of Criminal Justice];

37 : 1805-1813[=1812] Ditto [for Berbice. Publications and notifications. At first in Dutch, sometimes in two languages, but from about 1810 totally in English];

38 : 1788-1795 Ditto [for Berbice. Extracts of resolutions of the Board of Berbice and of the States-General. Includes also an index to the resolutions of the Board of Berbice from 1720 to 1795];

39 : 1802-1803 Extracts of Resolutions [for Berbice, from the Council of American Possessions];

40 : Mixed years Subject unknown [for Demarara and probably Berbice, miscellaneous papers];

41 : 1756-1781 Ditto [for Demarara, including protocols of measurement, deeds of conveyance, last will and testaments, etc.].
